text: Table I Common and rarer causes of a CS Orthopaedic Fractures and orthopaedic surgery Soft tissue Crush injury Circumferential burns Vascular Ischaemia—reperfusion injury Arterial and venous injuries Phlegmasia caerulea dolens (venous gangrene) latrogenic Drug or fluid extravasation Surgical positioning, especially prolonged lithotomy Large bore femoral vessel cannulation (e.g. intra-aortic balloon pumps or bypass circuits) Pneumatic anti-shock garments Other causes Recreational drugs and prolonged immobility resulting in ischaemia—reperfusion of limb or through intra-arterial injection Electrical injuries Venomous snakebite Heat stroke Sepsis, DIC e.g. purpura fulminans in meningococcal sepsis
